column4: Hm, anyone have a link to a good overall hardware burn-in tester? (ubuntu is randomly locking up, but i'm pretty sure it's not ubuntu's fault, same symptims described for windows 98 too)
try the memtester86 on the cd first, if you haven't already
i'm pretty sure it's not the ram, that was not part of the original system that was known to be issues, and i ran a cursory memtest alredy from my first failing install cd.
even if the ram is not defective, that will often keep a system busy enough as to trigger other problems....and everybody has it.....I just always suggest it as a place to start
